td.content: s:33 yr old white male programmer presents with moderate neck pain. he also reports mild blurred vision, mild dizziness, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the moderate neck pain. 3 days ago he sustained a blow to the back of the head.No LOC o:Height 166 cm, Weight 83.8 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 94, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 16, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, NAD, Neck = supple w/o TTP, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL w/ no deficits, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Psych = Mood, affect NL, appropriate judgement a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed CT Head, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:male programmer aged 33 years presents for approx. one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion. he denies neck pain, blurred vision and dizziness. Furthermore, he has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). he has resumed usual state of function. he drinks 2 beers per night Denies ever using tobacco o:Height 167 cm, Weight 85.4 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 95, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 17, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=98,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=46.1,Reaction Time=0.46, HEENT = NCAT, PERRL, C/V = RRR, Abd = Soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Neck = Supple, Pulm = CTAB. Good respiratory effort, MS = Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with no loss of consciousness). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.
